intro: Hiptage triacantha, commonly known as the three-spined hiptage, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive three-spined seed pods and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Hiptage triacantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
